title: RozoTheMiner
author: RozoTheMiner
created_time: September 30, 2023, 06:49:36 PMLast edit: October 03, 2023, 05:04:51 AM by RozoTheMiner
content: What's going on Cryptocurrency Universe! I hope everybody's is doing good! In my crypto dungeon, I have planned out and I'm going to attempt to build the world's largest orange pi cluster supercomputer with 125 orange pi, that I'm aware of. This thing will have more than 1,000 CPU cores, 500 gigabytes of RAM and draw less than 1000 Watts amazingly at full blast. In theory it's not built yet we'll see what it does when it's actually done. For those of you who would like to build your own you can use any SPC like the Raspberry Pi, Rock Pi, Banana Pi, or the Orange Pi like I did, it's just a lot more powerful with eight cores then the Raspberry Pi 5.Let's build 125 Pi Cluster Supercomputerhttps://youtu.be/UQzPH9smOhQ?si=fHUg7T_Y2It_MC1RThis is definitely an exciting build and I hope you guys enjoy it as well!Let's build Pi Cluster Supercomputer with 125 Orange Pi | Part 2https://youtu.be/UDBS5NSIjFQ?si=Y7BXR3kTDPSZxCqt

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Congrats on your design and good luck bringing it to fruition. I’ve always wanted to build a cool computer cluster of some kind but I’ve never really been sure what to do with it. Mining was something… Nowadays I guess the obvious would be using it for AI but the only ready built apps I’ve seen to be run off your own cluster are to generate images.

comments.author: RozoTheMiner
comments.body: Thanks I appreciate it and check out part 2, I'm getting much further along now.

comments.author: nsummy
comments.body: reminds me of when the guy built a 600 core odroid-xu4 cluster to mine Verium:  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2254852.0

comments.author: RozoTheMiner
comments.body: Stay tuned guys and if you missed any of the prior videos of this build make sure to check them out there's lots of good info in there.Let's build 125 Pi Cluster Supercomputer | How to build a SBC Cluster with Raspberry Pi or Orange Pi | Part 1https://youtu.be/UQzPH9smOhQLet's build Pi Cluster Supercomputer with 125 Orange Pi  | Part 2https://youtu.be/UDBS5NSIjFQPart 3 - Server Rack, The Beginnings of My HomeLab? | Let's build Pi Cluster with 125 Orange Pi'shttps://youtu.be/zQAqija-ihoServer Rack Tour and Adding LED Lights - Part 4 - of 125 Orange Pi Cluster Buildhttps://youtu.be/cHKl-qCITzUDesigning & Building Out The Power Delivery System - Part 5 - of 125 Orange Pi Cluster Buildhttps://youtu.be/wjVTJsjJOM4Discussing the 1500 watt USB power Power System - Part 6 - of 125 Orange Pi Cluster Buildhttps://youtu.be/lDsTwzEdtXYInstalling the last few Orange Pi 5 of 125 Orange Pi Cluster Build - Part 7https://youtu.be/sMofMdTu0X4

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: This is an interesting project. It's somethning I've thought about, whether a cluster of small efficient CPUs was viable as a mining platform.Your project convinced me to get serious about ARM support for cpuminer-opt.  I bought a RPI4b for development but I thing I'll upgradeto OPi, I like oranges more anyway.I'm nearing release of the first version of cpuminer-opt to support ARM CPUs, you may be interested. There's a lot of info about it on the githubwiki and the cpuminer-opt BCT thread, follow the links in my sig.In short it will initially support AES, SHA2 & NEON (equivalent of SSE2-SSE.4.2) on ARMv8. Longer term it willl include SHA3 and SVE. Keep up the good work.

comments.author: RozoTheMiner
comments.body: Thanks for your support and your miner sounds interesting, I did check it out can you add Verus hash to it?

comments.author: RozoTheMiner
comments.body: Just in case you haven't been following along here's the updated videos and the next one coming out will be turning on the world's largest orange pi cluster.Installing the Pi Cluster Supercomputer with 125 Orange Pi's into the Server Rack - Part 8https://youtu.be/sxA6mVKVcE4Building a Cryptocurrency Mining Rig using 125 Orange Pi's Mining Verus - Time To Wire It  - Part 9https://youtu.be/5unngePUxIoInstalling the Ethernet for 125 Pi Cluster Supercomputer Mining Rig Build - Part 10https://youtu.be/vshg26IqEzk
